business.headline: India-Pak tensions lift Chinese jet maker's stock by 36% in 2 daysAs of Thursday, the company's share price rose by 16.37% to reach 80.68 yuan. This was after a 17% jump on Wednesday. In total, the stock has gained 36.21% in two days and has gone up 44% in the past one month.

'Retirement age is moving from 60 to 45': An investment banker explains whyUnlike lawyers or doctors, where experience adds value, senior professionals in corporate roles like sales, marketing, operations, product, and tech, are seen as costly and sometimes out of touch, said the investment banker.

Why stock market investors shouldn't panic amid rising Indo-Pak tensionsWhile 'Operation Sindoor' led to worries about increased market volatility and losses, the main indices on Dalal Street actually managed to end in green in the previous session. Even today, the stock markets are trading in positive territory.

Pakistan's forex is slipping fast. More trouble ahead for already debt-ridden economy?A bailout by the International Monetary Fund (IMF), including a loan of $2 billion in March this year, gave Pakistan some breathing room. But the current situation could undo much of that progress.

'You can now automate strategies': Zerodha's Nithin Kamath on NSE's new algo rulesZerodha's founder and CEO, Nithin Kamath, hailed NSE's new rules to ease algo trading for retail users and explained the main update in simple terms.

Will rising Indo-Pak tensions dent foreign investment inflows to India?India's economy, which recently crossed the $4 trillion mark, has minimal direct trade with Pakistan. As a result, cross-border missile strikes carried out by India had limited immediate impact on domestic equities, currencies, or bonds.

Google cuts 200 jobs in latest round of restructuring: ReportGoogle described the changes as "small" adjustments meant to foster "greater collaboration" and improve how quickly teams can serve customers.

Sensex, Nifty erase early gains as market reacts to India-Pakistan tensionThe S&P BSE Sensex was trading down by 56.88 points to 80,689.90, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 32.25 points to 24,382.15 as of 9:30 AM.

Sensex, Nifty opening: Stock market to go down amid India-Pakistan tension?At 8:40 am, Gift Nifty futures were trading at 24,451. This suggests that the Nifty50 index may open marginally higher or close to Wednesday's closing level of 24,414.4 as investors are expected to be cautious.
Stocks to watch on May 8: Titan, Dabur, L&T, Asian Paints, PNBStocks to watch on Thursday, May 8, include several well-known companies such as Titan, Dabur, L&T, Asian Paints and PNB.
Government issues Letter of Intent to Musk's satellite internet venture StarlinkPrior to this, the government had issued licences to Eutelsat OneWeb and Jio Satellite Communications.

ULIPs, mutual funds or stocks: What's the best for long-term wealth creation?Mutual funds, ULIPs, and stocks offer different paths to wealth. While ULIPs mix insurance with investment, mutual funds offer flexibility and professional management. Stocks offer high returns but carry more risk and demand expertise.

entertainment.headline: Saif Ali Khan says Taimur has stage fear, doesn't want to perform publiclyTaimur Ali Khan, son of actors Saif Ali Khan and Kareena Kapoor Khan, is not interested in acting, said his father. Saif shared that his son feels shy on stage and doesn't like performing in front of people.

When director told Deepika she's 'taking motherhood seriously': Is it compliment?In a recent interview, Deepika Padukone shared an incident where a director commented on her commitment to motherhood. Deepika welcomed her daughter, Dua, in September last year.

Prateik Smita Patil recalls being a drug addict: Was thrown out of film instituteActor Prateik Smita Patil opened up on battling substance abuse. The 'HIT 3' and 'Sikandar' actor revealed that he regrets being in that reckless phase of life. Patil also narrated how he was 'thrown out' of a film institute due to addiction.

Proud of India, have deep respect for government: Mandana Karimi after backlashIranian actor Mandana Karimi faced backlash after her Instagram post mentioning Operation Sindoor. Now, she had reacted to it, clarifying that she is proud of India and has deep respect for the Indian government.

Nostalgia alert! Saif Ali Khan, Rani Mukerji's Hum Tum to re-release on May 16Actors Saif Ali Khan and Rani Mukerji's 'Hum Tum' is set to re-release in theatres on May 16. The film is directed by Kunal Kohli.

Karan Johar recalls his 'kambakht' one-sided love, says it still hurtsKaran Johar talked about experiencing one-sided love, and becoming the 'worst version' of himself, until he used those difficult feelings to 'empower' himself.

Dept. Q trailer: The Queen's Gambit maker promises hooking investigative thrillerThe new Netflix series 'Dept. Q', created by Scott Frank of 'The Queen's Gambit' fame, features Matthew Goode as an eccentric detective dealing with past trauma while solving cold cases in Scotland.

Aimee Lou Wood on SNL skit and her viral crying pics: People are quite boredActor Aimee Lou Wood, best known for 'Sex Education', has spoken up about the viral photos of her crying in public, days after the controversial SNL skit. She clarified that the pictures were unrelated and also urged people to stop over analysing everything.

Shahid Kapoor deletes 'India doesn't provoke' post on Op Sindoor, disables commentsActor Shahid Kapoor deleted his initial post about India's Operation Sindoor and disabled the comments. The actor's unexplained move has left the fans confused.

Actor Raghav Juyal's funny note to SRK for ending his Met Gala confusionActor Raghav Juyal shared a quirky note and thanked SRK for clearing his doubts regarding the Met Gala 2025. This came after SRK's grand debut at the fashion event.

Diljit Dosanjh gives desi-style review to fancy breakfast served after Met GalaDiljit Dosanjh's funny review of a fancy Louis Vuitton breakfast after the Met Gala 2025 has gone viral, winning over fans with his desi humour.

Producer Bhushan Kumar on what's stalling Bollywood: Films don't fail, budgets doBhushan Kumar, head of T-Series, is happy as Ajay Devgn's 'Raid 2' is nearing Rs 100 crore in India. In an interview with India Today, he shared insights on Bollywood's challenges and the path to recovery.

Rajkummar Rao's Bhool Chuk Maaf theatrical release cancelled amid security drillsThe theatrical release of 'Bhool Chuk Maaf', starring Rajkummar Rao and Wamiqa Gabbi, has been cancelled in the light of recent events. The film will now premiere on OTT.

Kylie Jenner, Timothee Chalamet make their relationship red carpet official. PicsKylie Jenner and Timothée Chalamet made their red carpet debut as a couple on Wednesday, May 7, at the David Di Donatello Awards in Rome. Take a look at the pictures here.

Cine association seeks ban on Pakistani artistes over Operation Sindoor remarksThe All India Cine Workers Association (AICWA) has called for a ban on Pakistani artristes. The association criticised statements made by them following India's Operation Sindoor.

Esha Deol says she doesn't behave like a single mother after separationIn a recent interview, Bollywood actress Esha Deol shared insights into her current relationship with her ex-husband Bharat Takhtani. She emphasised her approach to maintaining a cordial connection.

Raid 2 box office Day 7: Ajay's film is Rs 90 crore strong, eyes Rs 100 croreAjay Devgn's recently released film 'Raid 2' is holding steady at the box office. The film is now Rs 90 crore strong and is expected to enter the Rs 100-crore club soon.

Sonu Nigam's song from Kannada film removed two days after his apologySinger Sonu Nigam's song from the Kannada film, 'Kuladalli Keelyavudo', has been removed after his controversial remarks at his Bengaluru concert. Though he apologised for his remarks, action has been taken against him.

Anushka-Virat step out for a dinner date, fans notice something unusualIn their first public appearance since the Avneet Kaur controversy, Anushka Sharma and Virat Kohli were seen on a dinner date in Bengaluru. However, fans noticed something unusual, sparking a wave of online discussion.

general news.headline: Op Sindoor is ongoing; 100 terrorists killed, all parties told, say sourcesOperation Sindoor: At the all-party meeting, Defence Minister Rajnath Singh said 100 terrorists were killed in 'precise' attacks on nine terrorist hideouts in Pakistan.
Missile debris found in Amritsar village amid India-Pak tensions, Army on spotArmy personnel cordoned off the area where projectile debris has been found in the border area.

PM Modi's first message after Operation Sindoor as Centre briefs parties  Live UpdatesThe opposition parties were told about the valour of the armed forces as India struck terror camps deep inside Pakistan in an operation codenamed 'Sindoor'.

Desi 'suicide drones', expert in shoot-to-kill ops, make debut with SindoorOperation Sindoor: The SkyStriker 'suicide drones', developed in Bengaluru, made their operational debut during Operation Sindoor, where nine terror camps in Pakistan were destroyed.

What might have gone into making Operation Sindoor a successOperation Sindoor's success can be attributed to the culmination of the seamless integration of satellite, drone, and human intelligence with precise strikes by the IAF's fighter jets, executed under tight inter-service coordination. This is what might have happened in the days leading up to Operation Sindoor, and how it was executed.

US, UK, others urge citizens to avoid J&K travel amid rising Indo-Pak tensionsTension escalated after the Indian armed forces launched Operation Sindoor aimed at dismantling terror networks in Pakistan and Pakistan-Occupied Kashmir (POK).

15 civilians, jawan killed in Pak's relentless shelling along LoC after Op SindoorThe latest round of shelling came hours after India launched Operation Sindoor, a high-precision military offensive that struck nine terror camps in Pakistan and Pakistan-Occupied Kashmir.

Op Sindoor Live: Full blackout ordered in Punjab's Gurdaspur from 9 pm to 5 am dailyOperation Sindoor Live Updates: India carried out precision strikes on terror camps in Pakistan and Pakistan-occupied Kashmir in response to the April 22 Pahalgam terror attack which killed 26 people. The government said its actions have been "focused, measured and non-escalatory in nature" and that "no Pakistani military facilities have been targeted". Prime Minister Narendra Modi told his colleagues in the Cabinet meeting that it was a proud moment for everyone following the operation. The government held an all-party meeting today and briefed the Opposition following Operation Sindoor.  Follow Indiatoday.in for the latest updates.

Kashmir after Baisaran: 10 takeawaysPost the horrendous terror attack in Pahalgam's Baisaran meadows and the Indian armed forces retaliation, it is apparent that Kashmir is churning yet again, the churn reflecting many dimensions, old and new.

Pak national shot dead at Punjab border, attempted to cross despite warningThe Pakistani national was challenged by the BSF, but continued moving forward, prompting troops to open fire. He was shot dead on the spot.

Anushka-Virat step out for a dinner date, fans notice something unusualIn their first public appearance since the Avneet Kaur controversy, Anushka Sharma and Virat Kohli were seen on a dinner date in Bengaluru. However, fans noticed something unusual, sparking a wave of online discussion.

Op Sindoor's 100% precision: Satellite pics show direct hit on Jaish terror campCaptured by Maxar Technologies, the satellite visuals show before-and-after comparisons of sites in Bahawalpur and Muridke, both known strongholds of banned terror outfits.

Passenger beaten up in 3AC coach over pricing complaint. Railways reacts to videoIn the now-viral video, several men - allegedly pantry staff - are seen walking into the train compartment and confronting the passenger as he rests on his third-tier berth.

Blasts heard in Lahore, drone shot down day after India's Op Sindoor: ReportThe series of explosions in Lahore comes a day after India struck terror camps in Pakistan, in an operation named 'Sindoor', in response to the Pahalgam terror attack.

If possible, save everyone: Jaipur stadium gets bomb threat, cites Op SindoorJaipur's Sawai Man Singh (SMS) Stadium received bomb threat mail citing success of Operation Sindoor, according to an alert received by the Rajasthan State Sports Council.

Diljit Dosanjh, Emma Chamberlain and Cartier controversy about Patiala necklaceThe Internet cannot stop talking about why Diljit Dosanjh couldn't wear the Patiala Necklace at the Met Gala despite his stylist's efforts to source it from Cartier.

Diljit Dosanjh gives desi-style review to fancy breakfast served after Met GalaDiljit Dosanjh's funny review of a fancy Louis Vuitton breakfast after the Met Gala 2025 has gone viral, winning over fans with his desi humour.

21 airports shut till May 10, high alert: Border states on vigil after Op SindoorNationwide alerts, school and airport closures, government leave cancellations and emergency drills marked India's heightened security posture after Operation Sindoor — a precision military strike on terror hubs in Pakistan and POK.

Amazon India's Great Summer Sale 2025 is here: Transform your garden with upto 60% off on lawn & garden essentialsMake your Garden and Lawn summer ready with Amazon India's Great Summer Sale 2025 that is live now. Enjoy Up to 60% off on Lawn & Garden Essentials such as Plants, Solar Lights and more.

Kia Carens Clavis unveiled, new tech-loaded avatar to enhance premium characterKia has launched the Carens Clavis, an upgraded version of the Carens with new design and more features. Priced from Rs 11 lakh (ex-showroom), the Clavis will be offered alongside the existing Carens lineup.

Indicate left, turn right: PM Modi's art of deception Pakistan failed to noticeBefore both Balakot and 'Operation Sindoor', Prime Minister Narendra Modi kept public appearances routine, speeches calm, and intent hidden, masking precision strikes behind a poker face that Pakistan failed to read twice.

6 dead after private chopper crashes near River Bhagirathi in UttarakhandA private chopper, heading towards Gangotri shrine with 5 to 6 passengers onboard, crashed in Uttarakhand's Uttarkashi district around 9 AM.

Who is Sajid Mir, terrorist killed and brought back to life by PakistanDuring a press briefing on Operation Sindoor, Foreign Secretary Vikram Misri spoke about Sajid Mir, a terrorist declared dead by Pakistan in its attempt to shield him. Under international pressure, Pakistan was forced to admit that Mir was alive. He was one of the key plotters of the 26/11 terror attacks and the chief handler of the terrorists involved in the attack.

sports.headline: BCCI punishes Varun Chakravarthy for IPL code of conduct breach vs CSKKolkata Knight Riders (KKR) spinner Varun Chakravarthy was fined 25 percent of his match fee and handed one demerit point for breaching the IPL Code of Conduct against Chennai Super Kings (CSK) at Eden Gardens.

Rohit Sharma slams Indian commentary standards, says criticism is agenda-drivenRohit Sharma accused Indian commentators of focusing on a single star player and repeatedly discussing his personal life, rather than appreciating and analysing the game itself.

DC in must-win territory against PBKS in Dharamsala as playoff race heats upPBKS vs DC, IPL 2025 Preview: Delhi Capitals will be desperate to halt their downward slide and keep their playoff hopes alive when they face an in-form Punjab Kings in a high-stakes IPL 2025 clash in Dharamsala on Thursday.

Rohit Sharma did not announce Test retirement in a hurry: Childhood coachRohit Sharma's childhood coach Dinesh Lad said his ward did not take the decision to retire from Test cricket in haste. Rohit announced retirement weeks ahead of the selection for the Test team for the tour of England, starting June 20.

Arteta claims Arsenal are best team in Champions League despite semi-final exitMikel Arteta claimed that Arsenal were the best team in the Champions League and insisted they were "better" than PSG, despite their semi-final defeat.

Chess champion Yuzi Chahal has always proved naysayers wrong: PBKS coach JoshiIPL 2025: Speaking to the press on the eve of their game against Delhi Capitals in Dharamsala, Punjab Kings' spin-bowling coach Sunil Joshi heaped praise on Yuzvendra Chahal's consistency in the IPL and his ability to bounce back from setbacks.

Replacement spree continues as RR sign 19-year-old South Africa starRajasthan Royals have signed Lhuan-dre Pretorius to replace the injured Nitish Rana. This move comes amid a broader trend of mid-season player replacements in IPL 2025.

Rohit Sharma deserved a farewell Test: Manoj TiwariFormer India batter and Bengal captain Manoj Tiwari feels Rohit Sharma deserved a proper farewell on the field rather than an announcement via social media.

IPL 2025: Win over KKR brings immense satisfaction, says CSK's batting coachChennai Super Kings batting coach Michael Hussey said the hard-fought win over KKR would bring immense satisfaction to the players, support staff, and fans alike.

Ajinkya Rahane believes KKR can still qualify for playoffs despite CSK lossKolkata Knight Riders captain Ajinkya Rahane remains hopeful of playoff qualification following a heartbreaking loss to Chennai Super Kings at Eden Gardens on Wednesday. He believes KKR can still make it if they win their remaining two league matches, both of which are away fixtures.

DC head coach praises 'Operation Sindoor' as India strikes Pakistan terror campsDelhi Capitals (DC) head coach Hemang Badani expressed his heartfelt support for the Indian Army during a pre-match press conference ahead of DC's IPL 2025 encounter against Punjab Kings (PBKS) on Wednesday.

Rohit Sharma's Test retirement surprises Ajinkya Rahane: I will call himRohit Sharma's sudden Test retirement came as a shock to Ajinkya Rahane, his longtime teammate and friend. Speaking moments after KKR's loss to CSK on Wednesday, a visibly surprised Rahane learned of the news during the post-match press conference.

Jasprit Bumrah should captain in England Tests, Shubman Gill his deputy: MSK PrasadIndia tour of England: Speaking to IndiaToday.in, former chairman of selectors MSK Prasad dismissed concerns over Jasprit Bumrah's fitness and urged the selection committee to appoint him captain for the England Tests. India are on the lookout for Rohit Sharma's successor after the 38-year-old retired from Test cricket on Wednesday, May 7.

Who will not miss Rohit Sharma? Virender Sehwag on star batter's Test retirement Virender Sehwag heaped praise on Rohit Sharma and said that everyone will miss having the star batter in the squad after he announced his Test retirement on Wednesday, May 7. Sehwag feels that Rohit will have no regrets about making the call.

IPL 2025: Can KKR make it to the playoffs despite heartbreaking CSK loss?KKR's title defence took a massive hit after their heartbreaking loss to CSK at the Eden Gardens on Wednesday, May 7. However, the three-time champions can still make it to the playoffs, but will need help from others.

DC head coach on uncertainty around Delhi vs Punjab game: Have full faith in BCCIDelhi Capitals (DC) head coach Hemang Badani opened up on the uncertainty around their upcoming game against Punjab Kings in Dharamsala and put his faith in BCCI to take the right call.

PSG beat Arsenal to set up title clash with Inter MilanParis Saint-Germain secured their place in the UEFA Champions League final with a 2-1 victory over Arsenal. The French champions will face Inter Milan in a historic showdown, marking the first European clash between the two clubs.

Rohit Sharma: A topsy-turvy Test career which found its groove in 2nd inningsRohit Sharma announced his retirement from Test cricket after a 12-year-long career, which could well have begun three years earlier if not for a freak injury. After failing to live up to the expectations, the Hitman came back to rule the format in his rebirth as a Test opener and guided India to several memorable victories.

Dhoni breaks silence on potential retirement: Nothing for me to decide as of nowMS Dhoni commented on his potential retirement and claimed that there is nothing for him to decide at the moment. Dhoni said he will look at the six to eight months after the IPL and make a call.

Rohit Sharma's wife Ritika reacts to his Test retirement in emotional Instagram storyIndia captain Rohit Sharma's wife, Ritika Sajdeh, has given an emotional reaction to his Test retirement on her Instagram story. Rohit hung up his boots from the longest format after playing 67 matches and scoring 4301 runs.

Dewald Brevis, Noor help CSK snap losing streak, dent KKR playoffs hopesChennai Super Kings (CSK) ended their four-match losing streak with a two-wicket win over Kolkata Knight Riders (KKR) in Match 57 of the Indian Premier League 2025 (IPL 2025). Dewald Brevis (52 off 25) and Noor Ahmad (4/31) played a key role in CSK's win.

Rohit Sharma Test retirement: Gautam Gambhir, Rishabh Pant and cricketing world reactGautam Gambhir, Rishabh Pant and others paid tribute to Rohit Sharma after the 38-year-old announced his decision to retire from Test cricket. Rohit announced his decision on May 7.

Rohit Sharma's Test retirement before England tour a selfless call: MSK PrasadSpeaking to IndiaToday.in, former chairman of the selection committee MSK Prasad praised Rohit Sharma for announcing his retirement ahead of the upcoming England tour. Prasad also reflected on the decision to promote Rohit to open in Tests, a move that played a key role in reviving his career in red-ball cricket.

IPL 2025: RCB lose Devdutt Padikkal to injury, DC sign Harry Brook replacementRCB suffer a big blow as Devdutt Padikkal has been ruled out of the remainder of the season due to an injury. Bengaluru have signed Mayank Agarwal as Padikkal's replacement for the rest of the season.

IPL 2025: BCCI honours Indian armed forces' Operation Sindoor during KKR vs CSK gameThe Board of Control for Cricket in India (BCCI) honoured the Indian Armed Forces' Operation Sindoor, which targeted terrorist infrastructure in Pakistan and Pakistan-Occupied Kashmir (PoK) in the aftermath of the Pahalgam terrorist attack.

Who will replace Rohit Sharma as Test Captain for England Test series?Following Rohit Sharma's Test retirement ahead of the all-important England tour, the Indian team is left with massive shoes to fill in. There are five candidates who could be the ideal fit as Rohit's successor.

Bomb threat mail to Bengal cricket body amid KKR vs CSK matchThe Cricket Association of Bengal got a bomb threat mail during the KKR vs CSK match at Kolkata's Eden Gardens on Wednesday, May 7. The security at the Eden Gardens has been beefed up after the threat.

Thank you Rohit Sharma: Fans pay tribute to India captain after Test retirementFans paid tribute to Rohit Sharma after the 38-year-old announced his decision to retire from Tests with immediate effect on Wednesday, May 7. Rohit announced his decision via an Instagram story.

Rohit Sharma announces Test retirement via Insta story, to continue in ODIsCaptain Rohit Sharma announced his retirement from Test cricket. His decision comes days ahead of the selection of India's squad for the tour of England. The 38-year-old said he will continue to play for India in one-day internationals.

KKR vs CSK: Emotional MS Dhoni gets grand welcome at 'home ground' Eden GardensAn emotional MS Dhoni got a grand welcome from the crowd at the Eden Gardens ahead of the KKR vs CSK clash on Wednesday, May 7. Dhoni played a lot of cricket in his younger days in Kolkata.

KKR vs CSK: Venkatesh Iyer misses out due to injury, Manish Pandey in as replacementKolkata Knight Riders (KKR) all-rounder Venkatesh Iyer has been ruled out of his team's fixture against Chennai Super Kings (CSK) at Eden Gardens, Kolkata. Iyer hasn't had a memorable season with the bat after being sold for a whopping Rs 23.75 crore at the auction.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
